Node.definition: = man; ◄ son of Seraiah (שְׂרָיָה) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) ► priest (כֹּהֵן) and scribe (סֹפֵר) after exile
= action by which humans publicly admit their own shortcomings before God, or the shortcomings of the people they represent

Node.gloss: to cry|to weep|to lament|to mourn|to bewail
Node.definition: = action by which someone express his/her grief or sorrow by shedding tears, crying loud and making appropriate gestures, ◄ because of some personal or national calamity, or for a dead person
= action by which humans assume a lying position, often in order to show respect, allegiance, or devotion

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

Node.gloss: to come together|to gather|to assemble|to rally|to (re)unite
Node.definition: = action by which humans or animals come together as a group for a common purpose

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= state in which objects or events are numerous in quantity or frequency
= woman as a social class, to be distinguished from the men and the children
= posterity of humans and or animals of undetermined sex, at an age ranging from before birth to adulthood

Node.gloss: to cry|to weep|to lament|to mourn|to bewail
Node.definition: = action by which someone express his/her grief or sorrow by shedding tears, crying loud and making appropriate gestures, ◄ because of some personal or national calamity, or for a dead person

= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= various men; after exile
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= various men; ► heads of families; after exile

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= man; ◄ son of Seraiah (שְׂרָיָה) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) ► priest (כֹּהֵן) and scribe (סֹפֵר) after exile
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse, including those associated to him or her

Node.gloss: to commit a violation|to be unfaithful
Node.definition: = to do something that is not in line with the behavior that one has committed oneself to
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= caustaive action by which humans brings other humans into their home as their spouse
= woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not
= person who comes from a foreign country and therefore has a different status from those who are native born

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place

= state in which humans experience a desire for something to happen, together with a degree of confidence that this desire will be fulfilled through the intervention of someone else; as a result, they are willing to defer taking action for some time

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= a marker indicating that an important statement is following and demanding the attention of the listener

Node.gloss: to make a covenant|to make a treaty
Node.definition: literally: to cut (a covenant); hence: = action by which two or more parties make a solemn agreement, accompanied by stipulations, blessings, and curses
= a solemn agreement between two or more parties (persons, groups, nations, deities) with stipulations, blessings, and curses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

Node.gloss: to bring out|to take out|to carry out|to make (someone) leave|to make (someone) depart
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans, animals, or objects to leave a certain place or position
= woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not
= process by which females among humans or animals give birth to offspring through the process of conception, pregnancy, and labor; ≈ sometimes associated with painful toil and anxiety
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= process by which humans shake or tremble violently and involuntarily, ◄ caused by fear or another unnerving experience
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= causative action by which humans or deities offer instruction to (other) humans, ► aimed to teach the recipients wisdom and good behavior

= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse, including those associated to him or her

Node.gloss: to be strong (mentally)|to be courageous|to stand firm|to be resolute

Node.definition: = causative action by which humans cause other humans to make a solemn statement often calling on a higher power to confirm that what is said is true or to punish the speaker if it turns out not to be true

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= person ordained (מלא) and consecrated (קדשׁ) to perform religious services on behalf of others

= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= man; ► high priest (כֹּהֵן) after exile
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= to experience grief and show this by one's actions; ◄ caused by bereavement, loss, or other difficult circumstances
= a group of people who have been forcibly taken from their land to another

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
= member of a larger group of related people or objects, ◄ referred to as a child of that larger group
= causative action by which a group of people is forced to leave their country to settle somewhere else for an indefinite amount of time

Node.gloss: to come together|to gather|to assemble|to rally|to (re)unite

= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= state in which a countable entity is three in number

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine

= a council or a group of older men who act with authority on behalf of or over their people; some represent an entire nation, others manage the affairs at the town level; some provide their leader with counsel; involved in both judicial and military decisions, and participating in cultic ceremonies; ≈ expected to be wise and considered worthy of deference and respect

= causative actions by which humans set someone or something irrevocably apart for a deity, ► as a result of which people and animals are to be put to death, cities are to be destroyed, and other objects are to be set apart for the service of that deity
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
